SevenWonders

Class SevenWonders

  • java.lang.Object
    • SevenWonders.SevenWonders

  • public class SevenWonders
extends java.lang.Object
    Object representation of the game Seven Wonders. Seven Wonders is a card drafting game played by three to seven players using three decks of cards.

    At the start of the game, each player randomly receives a double-sided gameboard called the wonderboard. At the beginning of each of the three rounds, an initial hand of seven cards or structures. Each side gives an initial resource to the player and offers a different progression of stages.

    Players choose a single card from their hand to place around their wonderboard indicating the construction of the structure, tucked underneath a wonder stage indicating the construction of the stage, or are discarded for three gold. Once each player has chosen a card to play and the card's effects are resolved, each player passes their remaining hand of cards to the next player where play is repeated until one last card remains, which is then discarded. Between rounds, military conflicts are resolved between adjacent players. Each conflict compares the number of shield icons owned by each player, and awards victories to the player with the most icons. Once the game is over, the player with the most victory points is deemed the winner.

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private static final java.util.logging.Logger logger
        Logfile

      • discard

        private java.util.ArrayList<Structure> discard
        List of discarded structures. A structure is discarded by a player for three gold or if it is the last remaining card in a hand.

      • guildsDatabase

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Structure> guildsDatabase
        List of available guilds (purple cards) loaded from the databse. A randomized subset of 'playerCount + 2' of these structures are only available during the third round.

      • id

        private final java.lang.String id
        Internal identification number. Uniqueness is guaranteed via the use of UUID

      • library

        private java.util.ArrayList<Structure> library
        Current round's card pool. These structures are randomly assigned to in sets of seven to each player at the beginning of each round.

      • playerCount

        private final int playerCount
        Number of players within the game. A game can only have three to seven players.

      • players

        private java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
        List of players in sequential order. The order of the players dictates the seating order where players.get(0) is the left neighbor of players.get(1).

      • round

        private int round
        Current round. Dictates the unique set of cards available to theplayers during the round. The game is considered over at the end of round three.

      • seed

        private final long seed
        Randomizes the number generator. This seed is defined within the configuration file.

      • structureDatabase

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Structure> structureDatabase
        List of available cards loaded from the database. Different expansions can be enabled in the configuration file.

      • turn

        private int turn
        Current Turn. Each round consists of six turns, where at the beginning of each turn, the player chooses to play a card from a consecutively smaller hand.

      • wonderboardDatabase

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Wonderboard> wonderboardDatabase
        List of available wonderboards loaded from the libraries. Different wonderboards from expansions can be enabled within the configuration file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SevenWonders

        public SevenWonders(long seed,
                    int playerCount)
        Default Constructor. Initializes Seven Wonders, loads structure, guilds, and wondeboard databases.

      • nextRound

        private void nextRound()
        Begins the next round of the game, by incrementing roundCounter, resetting turnCounter to 0, repopulates the library with next round's cards, and refreshes any round-based effects.

      • nextTurn

        private void nextTurn()
        Begins the next turn by passing each player a new hand of cards if it is the first turn of the round or by passing each player's remaining cards to his left or right neighbor dependent on the round and the refreshes turn based effects

      • refreshEffects

        private void refreshEffects(Constants.Frequency f)
        Refreshes each effect belonging to each player. An effect may be useable once per game, once per round, or every turn.
        Parameters:
        freq: - Refresh rate

      • refreshHands

        private void refreshHands()
        Distributes seven cards to each player from the library.

      • refreshLibrary

        private void refreshLibrary()
        Repopulates the library dependant on the player count and the round.

      • resolveActions

        private void resolveActions(Player p)
        Resolve each players selectedAction with structure selectedStructure and removes the selectedStructure from the player's hand
        Parameters:
        p - - player

      • resolveConflicts

        private void resolveConflicts()
        Determines the results of military conflicts between rounds by comparing the shield count between each player and his respective neighbors.

      • resolveEffects

        private void resolveEffects(Player p)
        Resolves all effects granted to the player by built stages and built structures

      • run

        public void run()
        Main processing

      • setNeighbors

        private void setNeighbors()
        Randomly determines seating order and sets each player's neighbors.

      • setWonderboards

        private void setWonderboards()
        Randomly allocate wonderboards to each player by shuffling the wonderboardsDatabse array list, removing the second instance of any wonderboard up to the playerCount
